title: Noonan, the Jan. 6 Committee and Political Revenge
sub_head: Someone must be made to pay for that White House plate broken against the wall.
body:
Regarding Peggy Noonan’s column “The Courage of Cassidy Hutchinson” (Declarations, July 2): Ms. Hutchinson may be a wonderful person, but her appearance before the Jan. 6 committee was neither courageous nor heroic. It takes no courage to walk into a friendly room and tell the people sitting there exactly what they want to hear. Neither is it heroic to speak to a set of specifics for which she had no firsthand knowledge, as Ms. Hutchinson often did.
Little in Ms. Hutchinson’s testimony is admissible anywhere other than the court of public opinion, which is exactly where the Jan. 6 kangaroo court is conducting its trial of Donald Trump.
